basis: User explicitly commits to starting with water and box breathing, only proceeds to a tiny snack if doable, otherwise logs hunger/mood, and plans a post-logging reset activity (1-minute stretch or short indoor walk). Language is strongly proactive and flexible, indicating high likelihood of following through.
cognitive_dissonance: Conflict between eating to cope with anxiety and fear that eating could intensify anxiety, balanced by a plan to log and adjust in the moment; some discomfort with heat/stress influencing risk tolerance for snacking.
negative_thought_patterns: Tendency toward all-or-nothing thinking about snacks; worry about triggering anxiety; anticipatory stress about heat and Monday workload.
emotional_triggers: Anxiety about eating, heat (32Â°C), and Monday stress act as triggers that could undermine perceived control over eating and hydration.
coaching_notes: Maintain the emphasis on ultra-small, flexible steps and real-time adjustment. Reinforce self-monitoring (hunger/mood) and provide quick, actionable options. Remind them to reach their clinician if anxiety remains high. Keep plans simple and stepwise.
